attributes.action: Reduce the price of petrol to a reasonable amount by lowering fuel taxes.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Of the £1.15 per litre that we pay for our petrol, approximately 75p is tax.  

Petrol prices are getting ridiculous. It is time to do something about it.

Fuel duty is at 50.35p a litre, then VAT is added at 17.5%.

This means that an average tank of petrol, of 50 litres is costing £57.50, which breaks down as follows.

VAT - £10.06
Fuel Duty - £25.18
Actual cost of fuel - £22.26

That works out at £35.24 in tax!

With petrol prices being raised again this week (w/c 15/3/10), it is time made a stand.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
